template<class T >
bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::ReferenceCountedArray (  )  [inline]

template<class T >
bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::ReferenceCountedArray ( const ReferenceCountedArray< T > &  rca  )  [inline]

template<class T >
bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::ReferenceCountedArray ( const size_t  newSize  )  [inline, explicit]

Create an empty container with at least the specified bytes in size.

Parameters:
newSize Reserve at least this many bytes for this String.
Postcondition:
This string's memory will also never be shrunk.

A buffer has been created.

The idea behind this is that if a specific size was asked for, the buffer is like a char buf[N];

template<class T >
bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::ReferenceCountedArray ( const size_t  newSize,
const value_type  value 
) [inline]

Create a container filled with n copies of the given value.

Parameters:
newSize Reserve at least this many bytes for this String.
value The value to populate the array with
Postcondition:
This string's memory will also never be shrunk.

A buffer has been created.

template<class T >
virtual bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::~ReferenceCountedArray (  )  [inline, virtual]

Array Destructor.

Postcondition:
If the Array's Reference is not shared, it is free'd.

If the Array's Reference IS shared, it is decremented and detached.

Member Function Documentation

template<class T >
void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::AboutToModify ( size_t  n  )  const [inline, protected]

Warn the reference counting that it may need to COW.

Postcondition:
The buffer is detached/COW, and possibly larger
Todo:
If the buffer is shared and needs to shrink, the sublen should just be decreased.

template<class T >
void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::append ( const ReferenceCountedArray< T > &  rca,
int  n = -1 
) [inline]

Appends given rca to the end of buffer.

Parameters:
rca The rca to be appended.
n How many characters to copy from the ReferenceCountedArray object.
Postcondition:
The buffer is allocated. This is the same as inserting the rca at the end of the buffer.

template<class T >
void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::append ( const_reference  item  )  [inline]

Appends one item to end of buffer.

Parameters:
item The item to be appended.
Postcondition:
The buffer is allocated.

The item is appended at the end of the buffer. This is the same as inserting the item at the end of the buffer.

Returns:
The character at the given index.
Parameters:
i Index to return.
Precondition:
The index must exist.
See also:
operator[]()

Perhaps this should throw an exception if out of range?

template<class T >
void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::insert ( int  k,
const_reference  item 
) [inline]

Insert an item at the given index.

Parameters:
k The index to insert at.
item The item to be inserted.
Postcondition:
A buffer is allocated.

If the old buffer was too small, it is enlarged.

The item is inserted at the given index.

template<class T >
void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::insert ( int  k,
const ReferenceCountedArray< T > &  rca,
int  n = -1 
) [inline]

Inserts a ReferenceCountedArray object into our buffer.

Parameters:
k The index to insert at.
rca The rca to insert.
n The length to insert.
Postcondition:
The buffer contains n items from rca inserted at index k.

template<class T >
const ReferenceCountedArray& bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::operator= ( const_reference  item  )  [inline]

Sets our buffer to the given item.

Parameters:
item The item to set our buffer to.
Postcondition:
The old buffer (if we had one) is free'd.

A sufficiently sized new buffer is made with the item within.

Returns:
The new array object.

template<class T >
const ReferenceCountedArray& bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::operator= ( const ReferenceCountedArray< T > &  rca  )  [inline]

Sets our Reference to the given String reference.

Parameters:
rca The String object to reference.
Postcondition:
The old buffer (if we had one) is free'd.

Our Reference now points to the given String.

Our old rca object has been deleted (disconnected).

Returns:
The new rca object. This handles self-assignment just fine, checking for it explicitly would be ineffecient for most cases.

template<class T >
const_pointer bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::real_begin (  )  const [inline, protected]

int  n = -1 
) [inline]

Replaces n elements in our buffer at index k with the given ReferenceCountedArray object.

Parameters:
k The index to replace at.
rca The ReferenceCountedArray object to replace with.
n The number of characters to use for the replace.

template<class T >

const_reference  item 
) [inline]

Replace the given index with the given item.

Parameters:
k The index to replace.
item The item to replace with.
Postcondition:
The given index has been replaced.

COW is done if needed.

int  len = -1 
) [inline]

Return a new array from a subarray.

Returns:
a new ReferenceCountedArray
Parameters:
start The offset to begin the subarray from (indexed from 0)
len The length of the subarray to return The returned slice is a reference to the original array until modified.
